chart.title: Number of people that cannot afford a calorie sufficient diet
chart.subtitle: The cost of an energy sufficient diet is the cheapest way that an individual can meet their calorie requirement using available staple foods in each country.  A diet is defined as unaffordable when its cost, plus basic non-food needs like housing and transportation, exceeds daily income.
chart.citation: FAO and World Bank (2025), using data and methods from Herforth et al. (2022)

Number of people who cannot afford suffi.descriptionShort: Total number of people who cannot afford an energy-sufficient diet.
descriptionKey: An energy sufficient diet provides enough of a starchy staple food for day-to-day subsistence, without either nutrient adequacy or adherence to dietary guidelines.
This indicator is calculated as the percentage of a country's population that is unable to afford an energy sufficient diet, multiplied by the country's population.
Population counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship.
A value of zero indicates a null or a small number rounded down at the current precision level.
